snippet: A flight attendant for ExpressJet says she was wrongly suspended from her job last month because she refused to serve alcohol, citing her Muslim beliefs.
abstract: ExpressJet flight attendant Charee Stanley files discrimination complaint after being suspended for refusing to serve alcohol, which conflicts with her Muslim faith; agreement with airline to grant exception for her religious obligation dissolves after co-worker protests.
lead_paragraph: A flight attendant for ExpressJet says she was wrongly suspended from her job last month because she refused to serve alcohol, citing her Muslim beliefs.

headline.main: Alabama: Flight Attendant Complains of Religious Bias
headline.print_headline: Alabama: Flight Attendant Complains of Religious Bias
